Dear ,

I've come to your land to seek help for my kind in the Wintera Snowfield.

Please come to {@linkcreature:63#9004#me} so I can plead my case in person. But hurry! Winter doesn't last forever.

—Wintera Messenger
<PCNAME>, you came! I was worried...but that doesn't matter. Have a moment for a story?<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"I'm listening."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

Our homeland, the Wintera Snowfield, is divided into red, blue, and yellow areas. It's all governed by the wisest of us, Old Man Winter.

Or it was until a trickster disguised as Old Man Winter appeared, and now we can't tell which one's real!

The red and blue camps each believe that their Old Man Winter is the real one. (Among our people, yellow is the color of neutrality. We yellows don't fight.)"Where do I come in?"

We yellow ones are tired of being in the middle of this madness.

We couldn't convince the reds and blues to stop fighting, but at least we convinced them to make it a snowball fight. A nice, mostly nonlethal snowball fight. Our plan—and I admit it's kind of sketchy—is that the real Old Man Winter would certainly prevail in a snowball fight. They don't call him "Winter" for nothing!"Still not seeing the 'me' angle."

Open the Battleground Matching UI and select the "Winter Event" battleground. That sends you to the Wintera Snowfield.

Throw some snowballs, win a battle, then come back and tell me whether red or blue was victorious.

Remember, it's a snowball fight, not a real fight. Only certain skills work on the snowfield. Snowballs inflict low damage but can be thrown quickly because the cooldown time is short. Dirty snowballs hurt more, obviously. And giant snowballs can attack multiple targets.

One more thing: fireballs cancel harmful effects on your team members and restore their HP. Look for them in boxes.

Thank you, ! I'm adding your results to my tally, and soon we'll know whose Old Man Winter is the real Old Man Winter.

And please take this small token of my gratitude.
